interface graphique

class interface_graphique.main_interface_graphique.FinalScreen(selected_images_2, history_buttons)[source]

Bases : QWidget

A screen displayed after completing the portrait generation process.

This class shows a « Well Done! » message, the last selected portrait image, and buttons for downloading the image, downloading the history, and showing the history.

selected_images

List of selected images (QLabel objects) to be displayed.

Type:

list

history_buttons

Dictionary of historical buttons (QPushButton objects).

Type:

dict

add_buttons(layout)[source]

Adds the buttons for downloading the image, downloading the history, and showing the history to the layout.

create_neon_frame(image_label)[source]

Creates a neon flashing frame around the image.

download_history()[source]

Downloads all images from the history into a folder named “history”. Opens a file dialog for the user to select the download directory.

download_image()[source]

Downloads the last selected image as “selected portrait”.

Opens a file dialog to allow the user to choose where to save the image.

show_history()[source]

Displays the history of portraits as a grid of buttons. Creates a grid layout to display all the historical buttons.

toggle_neon_effect()[source]

Toggles the visibility of the neon frame to make it flash.

class interface_graphique.main_interface_graphique.MainScreen[source]

Bases : QWidget

Class representing the start screen of the application.

This window allows the user to: - View 20 random images from a temporary folder. - Select one or more images. - Choose between two actions: “GENERATE” (to generate a new image) or “COMBINE” (to merge several images). - Launch a process based on the selected images. - Regenerate a new set of images.

open_windows

List of open secondary windows.

Type:

list

tmp

Path to the “tmp” folder containing the images.

Type:

str

image_paths

List of file paths to the displayed images.

Type:

list

selected_images

List of images selected by the user.

Type:

list

selection_mode

Image selection mode (« combine » or « generate »).

Type:

str

add_buttons(layout)[source]

Ajoute les boutons d’action (COMBINE, GENERATE, EXIT, REGENERATE)

create_image_click_handler(image_label)[source]

Returns a click handler function for a given image

get_image_path_from_qlabel(image_label)[source]

Returns the absolute path of the image associated with a QLabel.

load_images()[source]

Loads 20 random images into the “grid_layout” from the “tmp” folder.

on_combine_button_click()[source]

Starts the process of combining images.

on_exit_button_click()[source]

Closes the current window and returns to the welcome screen (WelcomeScreen).

on_generate_button_click()[source]

Starts the process of generating a new image.

regenerate_images()[source]

Regenerates a new selection of 20 random images from the “data” folder and resets the selection.

toggle_image_selection(image_label)[source]

Selects or deselects an image based on its current state. The image’s state is visually changed by modifying its border color.

update_buttons_state()[source]

Enables or disables the buttons based on the number of selected images.

class interface_graphique.main_interface_graphique.PortraitWorkspace(selected_images, tmp)[source]

Bases : QWidget

A workspace for displaying and interacting with generated portraits.

This class allows the user to interact with a set of generated portraits by selecting them, generating new images, combining images, and viewing the result on the final screen. The screen shows the generated portraits of the genetic algorithm and the whole history of previous selected images.

tmp

The path to the directory containing the images.

Type:

str

genetic_portraits

A dictionary storing the last 4 generated portraits with their respective QIcons and QPushButtons.

Type:

dict

history_buttons

A dictionary of previously selected portrait buttons for quick access.

Type:

dict

generated_buttons

A list of QPushButtons created for the portraits.

Type:

list

selected_images

A list of selected portraits as QPushButtons.

Type:

list

selected_buttons

A list of selected portrait buttons for quick access.

Type:

list

add_buttons()[source]
add_to_history(icon)[source]

Adds an icon to the selection history if it is not already present.

Compares the new icon with the existing icons in the history to avoid duplicates. If the icon is unique, a new button is created for it and added to the history layout.

Paramètres:

icon (QIcon) – The icon representing an image to add to the history.

create_image_button(icon)[source]

This method creates a new QPushButton, sets its fixed size, assigns the provided icon to the button, and applies a style sheet to customize its appearance. The button’s click event is connected to a function that handles the selection toggling.

create_selection_handler(icon, btn)[source]

Returns a lambda function that toggles the selection of the button when checked or unchecked.

get_last_images(tmp)[source]

Fetches the last 4 images from the “tmp” folder in the form of a dictionary {QIcon: QPushButton}.

get_selected_image_paths()[source]

This method goes through the list of selected buttons and extracts the associated image paths. If the button has an “image_path” attribute, it appends the path to the list.

initUI()[source]
load_buttons_into_grid(buttons)[source]

Loads the buttons into the grid layout, removing any previous widgets.

This function clears the existing widgets from the grid layout, and then loads the buttons from the genetic_portraits dictionary into the layout in a 2-column format. After adding the buttons, it updates the state of the buttons based on the current selection.

on_combine_clicked()[source]

Handles the click event of the « Combine » button.

This method checks if at least two image buttons are selected. If so, it calls the combine_img function with the paths of the selected images, adds each selected image to the history, and resets the selection styles.

on_finish_button_click()[source]

Handles the click event of the « Finish » button.

This method converts each selected QPushButton from the selected_images list into a QLabel containing the corresponding image. Then, it passes these labels to the FinalScreen to display them.

on_generate_clicked()[source]

Handles the click event of the « Generate » button.

This method checks if exactly one image button is selected. If so, it calls the generate_img function with the selected image’s path, adds the image to the history, and resets the selection styles.

reset_selection_styles()[source]

Deselects all selected buttons and resets their style to the default.

toggle_selection(icon, btn)[source]

Toggles the selection state of a button (icon) and updates its appearance.

If the button is already selected, it will be deselected and the border color will be reset. If the button is not selected, it will be added to the selected list, and the border color will change to red.

update_buttons_state()[source]

This method checks the number of buttons currently selected and enables or disables the « Generate » and « Combine » buttons accordingly: - The « Generate » button is enabled only if exactly one button is selected. - The « Combine » button is enabled only if more than one button is selected.

class interface_graphique.main_interface_graphique.UndertaleDialog[source]

Bases : QWidget

Undertale-style tutorial window.

Displays a series of messages guiding the user through the interface, with a progressive text effect, a blinking cursor, an « OK » button to move on to the next message, and a progressive appearance animation.

blink_cursor()[source]

Flashes a “_” cursor at the end of the displayed text. Toggles between display with or without cursor every 500 ms.

increase_opacity()[source]

Gradually increases window opacity. Increments opacity until it reaches 1, then stops the animation timer.

initUI()[source]

Configures the tutorial’s graphical interface. Initializes title, dialog frame, animated text, « OK » button, and timers for progressive text display and cursor blinking.

next_dialog()[source]

Goes to the next message in the tutorial, or closes the window if there are none left. Resets text display and restarts letter-by-letter animation.

start_fade_in_animation()[source]

Starts a progressive window animation. Gradually increases opacity until the window is fully visible.

update_text()[source]

Gradually displays text letter by letter in the dialog box. Once the complete text is displayed, the cursor starts flashing and the « OK » button becomes visible.

class interface_graphique.main_interface_graphique.WelcomeScreen[source]

Bases : QWidget

Application home screen.

This class displays a home screen with an animated neon text effect. It can be used to trigger the tutorial display, switch to the application’s main screen or quit the application.

animate_neon()[source]

Animates the neon text effect by randomly varying the brightness. This effect simulates a neon light that flickers or flickers irregularly.

initUI()[source]

Initializes the graphical interface of the home screen.

Configures window, background image, ‘WELCOME!’ animated text with neon effect, buttons (‘Start’, ‘Tutorial’, ‘Exit’) and launches animations.

resizeEvent(event)[source]

Automatically resizes the background image when the window is resized.

show_tutorial()[source]

Open the tutorial

start_main_screen()[source]

Switches to the application’s main screen. Creates an instance of MainScreen, displays it and closes the home screen.

start_random_blinking()[source]

Starts a new animation with a random delay. The delay is between 50 and 400 ms.

start_zoom_animation()[source]

Launches a looping zoom-in/zoom-out animation on the text “WELCOME! The label label is enlarged up to 1.2x, then reduced, with a fluid effect.
